sense.name: members of a business or firm, contractually bound together
sense.commentary: PARTNERSHIP[+organization][+business] [+relation][+legal][+contractual] Note: implies a legal, binding contract among members
sense.examples: He joined that legal partnership in 1995. Several successful entrepreneurs formed a partnership to provide seed money to promising biotech start-ups. That California winery now has partnerships with two Italian and two French winemakers.

sense.name: people or organizations in cooperative relationships
sense.commentary: PARTNERSHIP[+relation][-legal][+cooperative] [+activity][+collaboration] Note: generally implies an informal, non-binding, cooperative relationship
sense.examples: These volunteer groups work in partnership with local law enforcement agencies. The director of that film developed a close partnership with the screen writer during the shoot. There is no longer the partnership between parents and teachers that once existed.
